titleStmt.title: [Fedele and Fortunio] [The deceites in loue: excellently discoursed in a very pleasaunt and fine conceited comoedie, of two Italian gentlemen. Translated out of Italian, and set downe according as it hath beene presented before the Queenes moste excellent Maiestie].
Fedele. English
titleStmt.author: Pasqualigo, Luigi.
Munday, Anthony, 1553-1633.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by John Charlewood?] for Thomas Hacket, and are to be solde at his shop in Lumberd streete, vnder the Popes head,

notesStmt.note: A translation and adaptation of: Pasqualigo, Luigi. Il Fedele.
Title, imprint and printer's name suggested by STC (2nd ed.).
Translator's dedication to John Heardson signed: A.M., i.e. Anthony Munday. Variant: with a dedication instead to Maister M.R., signed: M.A. Cf. Folger Shakespeare Library.
Imperfect: lacks gatherings A, B and D4.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
